pages.description: Learn about Zyros static site generator and its core features
pages.content:
# Introduction to Zyros

Welcome to **Zyros**, a developer-friendly static site generator that transforms simple JSON configuration into beautiful, fast websites.

## What is Zyros?

Zyros is a modern static site generator built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS. It allows you to create professional websites using just a JSON configuration file, without writing complex code or dealing with complicated build processes.

## Key Features

### üöÄ Zero Configuration
- Works out of the box with sensible defaults
- No complex webpack configurations or build tools
- Single JSON file for all content and settings

### üé® Beautiful Themes
- 8 professionally designed themes
- Real-time theme switching
- Customizable color schemes and typography

### ‚ö° Performance Optimized
- Static generation for lightning-fast loading
- Automatic image optimization
- SEO-friendly output

### üõ†Ô∏è Developer Friendly
- TypeScript support
- Modern React components
- Extensible architecture

## Who Should Use Zyros?

### Developers
- Rapid prototyping and MVP development
- Client projects with quick turnaround
- Personal blogs and portfolios

### Content Creators
- Bloggers who want full control
- Technical writers and documentation
- Marketing teams building landing pages

### Agencies
- Client websites with easy maintenance
- Template-based project delivery
- Scalable multi-site management

## How It Works

1. **Initialize** - Create a new project with `zyros init`
2. **Configure** - Edit the `site.json` file with your content
3. **Develop** - Run `zyros dev` to preview your site
4. **Deploy** - Use `zyros deploy` to publish to your hosting platform

## Next Steps

- [Installation Guide](/installation) - Set up Zyros on your system
- [Quick Start](/quick-start) - Build your first site in 5 minutes
- [API Reference](/api) - Detailed configuration options
- [Examples](/examples) - Real-world implementation examples

---

*Ready to get started? Let's [install Zyros](/installation) and build something amazing!*

pages.title: Installation Guide
pages.description: Step-by-step guide to installing and setting up Zyros
pages.content:
# Installation Guide

Get Zyros up and running on your system in just a few minutes.

## System Requirements

### Prerequisites
- **Node.js** 18.0.0 or higher
- **npm** 8.0.0 or higher (or yarn/pnpm)
- **Git** (recommended for version control)

### Supported Platforms
- macOS (Intel and Apple Silicon)
- Windows 10/11
- Linux (Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS, etc.)

## Installation Methods

### Method 1: Using npx (Recommended)

The easiest way to get started without installing Zyros globally:

```bash
# Create a new project
npx zyros@latest init my-website

# Navigate to your project
cd my-website

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev
```

### Method 2: Global Installation

Install Zyros globally to use it anywhere:

```bash
# Install globally
npm install -g zyros

# Create a new project
zyros init my-website

# Navigate and start
cd my-website
npm install
npm run dev
```

### Method 3: From Source (Advanced)

For contributors or advanced customization:

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/zyrasoftware/zyros.git
cd zyros

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Build the project
npm run build

# Link for global use
npm link
```

## Verification

Verify your installation:

```bash
# Check Zyros version
zyros --version

# View available commands
zyros --help

# Create a test project
zyros init test-site
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Permission Errors (macOS/Linux)
```bash
# Fix npm permissions
sudo chown -R $(whoami) ~/.npm

# Or use a Node version manager
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash
nvm install node
```

#### Windows Path Issues
```powershell
# Run as Administrator and add to PATH
$env:PATH += ";C:\Users\YourName\AppData\Roaming\npm"
```

#### Node Version Conflicts
```bash
# Check Node version
node --version

# Update Node.js
npm install -g n
n latest
```

### Getting Help

If you encounter issues:

1. Check our [FAQ](/faq) for common solutions
2. Search [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/zyrasoftware/zyros/issues)
3. Join our [Discord community](https://discord.gg/zyros)
4. Email support: support@zyros.dev

## Next Steps

Now that Zyros is installed:

- [Quick Start Guide](/quick-start) - Build your first site
- [Configuration](/configuration) - Learn about site.json
- [CLI Commands](/cli) - Master the command line tools

---

*Installation complete! Ready to [create your first site](/quick-start)?*

pages.title: Quick Start Guide
pages.description: Build your first Zyros website in 5 minutes
pages.content:
# Quick Start Guide

Build your first Zyros website in just 5 minutes! This guide will walk you through creating a simple blog from scratch.

## Step 1: Create Your Project

```bash
# Create a new Zyros project
npx zyros@latest init my-blog

# Navigate to your project
cd my-blog

# Install dependencies
npm install
```

## Step 2: Start Development Server

```bash
# Start the development server
npm run dev
```

Your site will be available at `http://localhost:3000`.

## Step 3: Customize Your Site

Open `public/site.json` in your favorite editor and customize:

### Basic Site Information
```json
{
  "site": {
    "title": "My Awesome Blog",
    "description": "A blog about web development and design",
    "author": "Your Name",
    "theme": "ocean"
  }
}
```

### Add Your First Post
```json
{
  "pages": [
    {
      "title": "Hello World",
      "slug": "hello-world",
      "description": "My first blog post",
      "category": "blog",
      "tags": ["introduction", "hello"],
      "publishedAt": "2024-01-20",
      "content": "# Hello World\n\nWelcome to my new blog!"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Step 4: Explore Themes

Try different themes by changing the `theme` value:

- `light` - Clean and bright
- `dark` - Modern dark theme
- `ocean` - Cool blue tones
- `sunset` - Warm orange/pink
- `forest` - Natural green
- `minimal` - Ultra-clean
- `midnight` - Deep purple
- `neon` - Cyberpunk green

## Step 5: Add More Content

### Create an About Page
```json
{
  "title": "About Me",
  "slug": "about",
  "description": "Learn more about me",
  "content": "# About Me\n\nI'm a developer passionate about..."
}
```

### Add Navigation
```json
{
  "header": {
    "navigation": [
      { "title": "Home", "href": "/" },
      { "title": "About", "href": "/about" },
      { "title": "Blog", "href": "/blog" }
    ]
  }
}
```

## Step 6: Build for Production

```bash
# Build your site
npm run build

# The built site will be in the 'out' directory
```

## Step 7: Deploy Your Site

Choose your preferred hosting platform:

### Vercel (Recommended)
```bash
# Install Vercel CLI
npm install -g vercel

# Deploy
vercel --prod
```

### Netlify
```bash
# Install Netlify CLI
npm install -g netlify-cli

# Deploy
netlify deploy --prod --dir=out
```

### GitHub Pages
```bash
# Use the built-in deploy command
zyros deploy github
```

## What's Next?

Congratulations! You've built and deployed your first Zyros site. Here's what to explore next:

### Learn More
- [Site Configuration](/configuration) - Detailed configuration options
- [Content Management](/content-management) - Advanced content features
- [Themes & Customization](/themes) - Create custom themes
- [API Reference](/api) - Complete API documentation

### Advanced Features
- [Content Blocks](/api/content-blocks) - Rich interactive sections
- [Forms](/api/forms) - Contact forms and user input
- [SEO Optimization](/seo) - Search engine optimization
- [Analytics](/analytics) - Track your site's performance

### Get Help
- [FAQ](/faq) - Common questions and solutions
- [GitHub](https://github.com/zyrasoftware/zyros) - Source code and issues
- [Discord](https://discord.gg/zyros) - Community support

---

*Great job! You've successfully created your first Zyros site. Ready to [dive deeper](/configuration)?*

pages.content:
# CLI Commands Reference

Zyros provides a comprehensive command-line interface for managing your static sites. This reference covers all available commands and their options.

## Global Options

These options are available for all commands:

```bash
--help, -h     Show help information
--version, -v  Show version number
--verbose      Enable verbose logging
--quiet        Suppress all output except errors
```

## Project Management

### zyros init

Create a new Zyros project.

```bash
zyros init <project-name> [options]
```

#### Options
- `--template, -t <name>` - Use a specific template
- `--force, -f` - Overwrite existing directory
- `--no-install` - Skip npm install
- `--git` - Initialize git repository

#### Examples
```bash
# Basic project
zyros init my-blog

# Use portfolio template
zyros init my-portfolio --template portfolio

# Skip dependency installation
zyros init my-site --no-install
```

### zyros dev

Start the development server.

```bash
zyros dev [options]
```

#### Options
- `--port, -p <number>` - Port number (default: 3000)
- `--host, -H <host>` - Host address (default: localhost)
- `--open, -o` - Open browser automatically

#### Examples
```bash
# Start on default port
zyros dev

# Custom port and host
zyros dev --port 8080 --host 0.0.0.0

# Open browser automatically
zyros dev --open
```

### zyros build

Build the site for production.

```bash
zyros build [options]
```

#### Options
- `--output, -o <dir>` - Output directory (default: out)
- `--analyze` - Analyze bundle size
- `--no-lint` - Skip linting

#### Examples
```bash
# Standard build
zyros build

# Custom output directory
zyros build --output dist

# Analyze bundle
zyros build --analyze
```

## Content Management

### zyros content create

Create a new content page.

```bash
zyros content create [options]
```

#### Options
- `--title, -t <title>` - Page title
- `--slug, -s <slug>` - URL slug
- `--category, -c <category>` - Page category
- `--template <template>` - Content template
- `--interactive, -i` - Interactive mode

#### Examples
```bash
# Interactive creation
zyros content create --interactive

# Quick creation
zyros content create --title "My Post" --slug my-post
```

### zyros content list

List all content pages.

```bash
zyros content list [options]
```

#### Options
- `--category, -c <category>` - Filter by category
- `--tag, -t <tag>` - Filter by tag
- `--format, -f <format>` - Output format (table, json, csv)
- `--sort, -s <field>` - Sort by field

#### Examples
```bash
# List all content
zyros content list

# Filter by category
zyros content list --category blog

# JSON output
zyros content list --format json
```

### zyros content delete

Delete a content page.

```bash
zyros content delete <slug> [options]
```

#### Options
- `--force, -f` - Skip confirmation
- `--backup` - Create backup before deletion

#### Examples
```bash
# Delete with confirmation
zyros content delete my-old-post

# Force delete
zyros content delete my-old-post --force
```

### zyros content stats

Show content statistics.

```bash
zyros content stats [options]
```

#### Options
- `--detailed, -d` - Show detailed statistics
- `--category, -c <category>` - Stats for specific category

## Template Management

### zyros template list

List available templates.

```bash
zyros template list [options]
```

#### Options
- `--category, -c <category>` - Filter by category
- `--detailed, -d` - Show detailed information

### zyros template apply

Apply a template to current project.

```bash
zyros template apply <template-name> [options]
```

#### Options
- `--force, -f` - Overwrite existing files
- `--backup` - Create backup before applying

### zyros template create

Create a custom template from current project.

```bash
zyros template create <template-name> [options]
```

#### Options
- `--description, -d <desc>` - Template description
- `--author, -a <author>` - Template author
- `--force, -f` - Overwrite existing template

## Deployment

### zyros deploy

Deploy your site to various platforms.

```bash
zyros deploy <platform> [options]
```

#### Supported Platforms
- `vercel` - Deploy to Vercel
- `netlify` - Deploy to Netlify
- `github` - Deploy to GitHub Pages
- `s3` - Deploy to AWS S3

#### Options
- `--prod` - Deploy to production
- `--preview` - Deploy as preview
- `--domain <domain>` - Custom domain
- `--env <file>` - Environment file

#### Examples
```bash
# Deploy to Vercel
zyros deploy vercel --prod

# Deploy to Netlify with custom domain
zyros deploy netlify --domain mydomain.com

# Deploy to GitHub Pages
zyros deploy github
```

## Optimization

### zyros optimize

Optimize your site's assets.

```bash
zyros optimize [options]
```

#### Options
- `--images` - Optimize images only
- `--webp` - Generate WebP versions
- `--cleanup` - Clean up optimization artifacts

#### Examples
```bash
# Full optimization
zyros optimize

# Images only
zyros optimize --images

# Generate WebP
zyros optimize --webp
```

## Validation

### zyros validate

Validate your site configuration and content.

```bash
zyros validate [options]
```

#### Options
- `--strict` - Enable strict validation
- `--fix` - Auto-fix common issues
- `--report <file>` - Save report to file

#### Examples
```bash
# Basic validation
zyros validate

# Strict mode with auto-fix
zyros validate --strict --fix
```

## Configuration

### zyros config

Manage configuration settings.

```bash
zyros config [command] [options]
```

#### Commands
- `list` - Show all configuration
- `get <key>` - Get specific value
- `set <key> <value>` - Set configuration value
- `delete <key>` - Delete configuration

#### Examples
```bash
# List all config
zyros config list

# Get site title
zyros config get site.title

# Set theme
zyros config set site.theme dark
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Command Not Found
```bash
# Reinstall globally
npm install -g zyros@latest

# Check installation
which zyros
zyros --version
```

#### Permission Errors
```bash
# Fix npm permissions (macOS/Linux)
sudo chown -R $(whoami) ~/.npm

# Use npx instead
npx zyros@latest <command>
```

#### Build Failures
```bash
# Clear cache
rm -rf .next node_modules
npm install

# Validate configuration
zyros validate --strict
```

### Getting Help

```bash
# Command help
zyros <command> --help

# General help
zyros --help

# Version info
zyros --version
```

---

*Need more help? Check our [FAQ](/faq) or join our [Discord community](https://discord.gg/zyros).*
